tickets.title: No Wi-Fi Connection in Office A
tickets.description: Users in Office A are unable to connect to the Wi-Fi network. This is impacting productivity.

tickets.title: Software Installation Request - New Employee
tickets.description: Request to install necessary software (Microsoft Office Suite, Adobe Reader) on the new employee, Peter Jones's, laptop.

tickets.title: Printer Jamming Frequently - Finance Department
tickets.description: The main printer in the Finance department keeps jamming multiple times a day, causing delays.

tickets.title: Urgent: Server Down - Website Unavailable
tickets.description: The main company website is currently down and inaccessible to users. This is a critical issue.

tickets.title: Password Reset Request - Account Locked
tickets.description: User Sarah Miller has locked her account and needs a password reset.
tickets.resolutionDescription: Successfully reset the user's password and unlocked the account. The new temporary password was sent to the user's registered email address. User confirmed they can now access their account without any issues.
tickets.agentFeedback: The account lockout was due to multiple failed login attempts. Recommended user to use strong passwords and enable two-factor authentication for enhanced security. User was educated about password security best practices.

tickets.title: Email Delivery Failure - Multiple Users
tickets.description: Several users in Sales are reporting emails not being sent or received.

tickets.title: Laptop Battery Not Charging
tickets.description: The laptop of Mark Johnson is not charging properly, even when plugged in.

tickets.title: Access Request to Confidential Files
tickets.description: Request for access to confidential financial reports for audit purposes.

tickets.title: VPN Connection Timeout
tickets.description: Users are experiencing VPN disconnections frequently during work hours.

tickets.title: New Software License Purchase Request
tickets.description: Request to purchase additional licenses for Photoshop and Illustrator.
tickets.resolutionDescription: Software licenses purchased and delivered to the design team.

tickets.title: Office A Air Conditioning Not Working
tickets.description: Temperature in Office A is too high due to air conditioning malfunction.

tickets.title: Email Configuration Fixed
tickets.description: User Sarah Miller's email configuration has been successfully updated and is now working properly.

tickets.title: HR System Access Request
tickets.description: Employee needs access to HR system for viewing payroll information.

tickets.title: Network Connectivity Issues
tickets.description: Multiple workstations experiencing intermittent network disconnections.

tickets.title: Employee Onboarding Setup
tickets.description: New employee needs laptop setup and account creation.

tickets.title: HR Department Support Request
tickets.description: General support request for HR department operations.

tickets.title: Test for HR Department
tickets.description: Test ticket for HR department workflow validation.

tickets.title: Printer Hardware Issue
tickets.description: The office printer requires immediate attention due to hardware malfunction affecting daily operations.
tickets.resolutionDescription: Printer hardware issue resolved. Replaced faulty components and performed system diagnostics.
tickets.agentFeedback: Hardware replacement completed successfully. Printer is fully operational.

tickets.title: Password Reset Request
tickets.description: User requesting password reset due to login issues.

tickets.title: File Upload System Testing
tickets.description: Testing file upload functionality and attachment handling for the ticketing system.

feedback.message: I had a fantastic experience from start to finish. The team was incredibly professional, friendly, and attentive to my needs. The support provided was exceptional.

feedback.name: Larry Hills
feedback.title: Highly Satisfied with the Service!
feedback.message: Service was quick, staff were polite, and I got the help I needed in no time.

feedback.name: John Doe
feedback.title: Great Service!
feedback.message: Really loved the support. The team was responsive and solved my issue quickly.

feedback.name: Benjie Garcia
feedback.title: Excellent Support Team!
feedback.message: The support team was very helpful in resolving my account access issue. Everything works perfectly now!

articles.title: Basics of Computer Hardware and Software
articles.author: Alex Rivera
articles.content:
A computer system is made up of two main elements: hardware and software. Understanding both is important for anyone interested in technology.

Computer hardware refers to the physical parts of a computer system. This includes:
â€¢ Central Processing Unit (CPU) â€“ the brain of the computer that processes instructions.
â€¢ Random Access Memory (RAM) â€“ temporary memory used to run programs quickly.
â€¢ Hard Drive (HDD) or Solid-State Drive (SSD) â€“ where files and programs are stored.
â€¢ Motherboard â€“ the main circuit board connecting all components.
â€¢ Input Devices â€“ like keyboards, mice, and scanners.
â€¢ Output Devices â€“ like monitors, printers, and speakers.

Software, on the other hand, is a set of instructions that tells the hardware what to do. Software can be divided into two types:
â€¢ System software â€“ like operating systems (Windows, macOS, Linux) that manage hardware and allow other programs to run.
â€¢ Application software â€“ like Microsoft Word, web browsers, or games that let users perform specific tasks.

Without software, hardware is useless. And without hardware, software has nothing to run on. Both work together to make computers useful tools in business, education, and personal life.

articles.title: Understanding Operating Systems
articles.author: Alex Rivera
articles.content:
An Operating System (OS) is essential software that acts as a bridge between the user, applications, and the computer hardware. It controls the systemâ€™s memory, processes, devices, and software.

Some of the most common operating systems include:
â€¢ Microsoft Windows â€“ widely used in homes and offices.
â€¢ macOS â€“ used on Appleâ€™s desktop and laptop computers.
â€¢ Linux â€“ popular in servers and tech environments.
â€¢ Android and iOS â€“ used in mobile phones and tablets.

The OS performs several important functions:
â€¢ Manages hardware resources, like the CPU, memory, and storage.
â€¢ Provides a user interface, such as a desktop or command line.
â€¢ Handles system security, including user permissions and virus protection.
â€¢ Manages files, allowing users to create, delete, and organize data.
â€¢ Runs applications, ensuring software can access needed resources.

Without an operating system, you would not be able to use your computer. It plays a central role in everything from browsing the internet to playing music or writing a report.

articles.title: Big Data Fundamentals
articles.author: James Quijano
articles.content: Big Data refers to extremely large datasets that require specialized tools and techniques to process, analyze, and extract meaningful insights. This article covers the fundamentals of Big Data technologies, including storage solutions, processing frameworks, and analytics platforms used in modern organizations.
